p: Diets are a central focus of a transition toward more sustainable food and land-use systems. Beyond the need to deliver on food and nutritional security, dietary shifts are necessary to tackle the rise in obesity and non-communicable diseases, while also alleviating the pressure of a growing and more affluent population on natural resources. The recognition of the link between human and environmental health underscores the importance of pursuing a more integrated approach to diets (Willett et al., 2019).
